warning_signs: Swelling, shortness of breath, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure daily, weigh yourself daily

dietary_restrictions: Low potassium diet, limit protein to 0.8g/kg body weight
warning_signs: Confusion, severe fatigue, irregular heartbeat
discharge_instructions: Stay hydrated, avoid NSAIDs, monitor urine output

dietary_restrictions: Diabetic diet, low sodium (2g/day), limit protein
warning_signs: Blood sugar below 70 or above 300, swelling, chest pain
discharge_instructions: Check blood sugar 4 times daily, monitor blood pressure, foot care

warning_signs: Severe back or side pain, blood in urine, fever
discharge_instructions: Maintain blood pressure control, avoid contact sports

medications: Sevelamer 800mg three times daily with meals
dietary_restrictions: Low phosphorus, low potassium, protein restriction (0.6g/kg)
follow_up: Nephrology clinic weekly, discuss dialysis preparation
warning_signs: Severe nausea, confusion, chest pain, difficulty breathing
discharge_instructions: Prepare for dialysis access placement, attend kidney education classes

dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, adequate calcium and vitamin D
warning_signs: Fever, severe joint pain, facial rash worsening, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid sun exposure, take medications with food, monitor for infections

warning_signs: Visible blood in urine, severe swelling, high blood pressure
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure, avoid respiratory infections

warning_signs: Severe swelling, difficulty breathing, weight gain >5 lbs in 2 days
discharge_instructions: Daily weights, monitor for edema, gradual steroid taper as directed

follow_up: Nephrology clinic weekly for tacrolimus levels
warning_signs: Tremors, confusion, severe swelling, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Take tacrolimus on empty stomach, avoid grapefruit, monitor blood pressure

dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, consistent vitamin K intake
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks, INR check in 3 days
warning_signs: Unusual bleeding, severe bruising, blood in urine or stool
discharge_instructions: Avoid NSAIDs, maintain consistent diet, report any bleeding

warning_signs: Severe headache, vision changes, chest pain
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure twice daily, maintain blood pressure log

warning_signs: Swelling, decreased urine output, fatigue
discharge_instructions: Annual kidney function monitoring, maintain healthy weight

warning_signs: Dark urine, muscle pain, weakness, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid strenuous exercise for 2 weeks, stay well hydrated

warning_signs: Severe swelling, difficulty breathing, chest pain, blood clots
discharge_instructions: Daily weights, compression stockings, monitor for infections

warning_signs: Hearing changes, vision problems, blood in urine
discharge_instructions: Annual hearing and vision screening, genetic counseling

dietary_restrictions: Renal diet: low potassium, low phosphorus, protein 0.6g/kg, sodium <2g/day
follow_up: Nephrology clinic weekly, dialysis access surgery scheduled
warning_signs: Severe nausea/vomiting, confusion, chest pain, irregular heartbeat
discharge_instructions: Attend dialysis education classes, prepare for fistula placement, avoid blood pressure cuffs on fistula arm

medications: Penicillin V 500mg twice daily for 10 days
dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, fluid restriction if swelling persists
warning_signs: Worsening swelling, decreased urine output, severe headache
discharge_instructions: Complete antibiotic course, monitor blood pressure, rest

dietary_restrictions: High fluid intake (2.5-3L/day), low sodium, limit animal protein
follow_up: Urology in 1 week for stone analysis
warning_signs: Severe pain, fever, inability to urinate, blood in urine
discharge_instructions: Strain urine for stones, increase water intake, avoid high-oxalate foods

medications: Sodium bicarbonate 650mg three times daily for 3 days
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 1 week for repeat kidney function
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, swelling, confusion
discharge_instructions: Stay well hydrated, avoid NSAIDs and other nephrotoxic medications

follow_up: Nephrology and Pulmonology in 1 week, plasmapheresis schedule
warning_signs: Coughing up blood, difficulty breathing, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid infections, report respiratory symptoms immediately, attend plasmapheresis sessions

follow_up: Nephrology and Vascular Surgery in 2 weeks
warning_signs: Severe headache, chest pain, sudden weakness
discharge_instructions: Monitor blood pressure, medication compliance critical, may need angioplasty

dietary_restrictions: Well-cooked meats, avoid unpasteurized dairy, high fluid intake
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 3 days for labs
warning_signs: Decreased urine output, severe abdominal pain, bloody diarrhea, confusion
discharge_instructions: Monitor for anemia symptoms, ensure food safety, rest

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3 with Anemia
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 2 weeks for hemoglobin check
warning_signs: Severe fatigue, chest pain, shortness of breath
discharge_instructions: Take iron supplements, monitor for side effects, gradual activity increase

warning_signs: Rash, fever, decreased urine output
discharge_instructions: Avoid causative medication (NSAIDs), complete steroid taper, monitor kidney function

dietary_restrictions: Low sodium, avoid grapefruit, food safety precautions
follow_up: Transplant clinic in 2 days for labs and possible biopsy
warning_signs: Fever, decreased urine output, pain over transplant, weight gain
discharge_instructions: Strict medication compliance, monitor temperature, avoid sick contacts, report any symptoms immediately

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3 with Hyperparathyroidism
medications: Calcium carbonate 500mg three times daily with meals
follow_up: Nephrology clinic in 4 weeks for PTH and calcium levels
warning_signs: Bone pain, muscle weakness, kidney stones
discharge_instructions: Take medications as directed, avoid high phosphorus foods, monitor for symptoms

primary_diagnosis: Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 4 with Metabolic Acidosis
dietary_restrictions: Low potassium, low phosphorus, protein restriction
warning_signs: Rapid breathing, confusion, severe fatigue
discharge_instructions: Take sodium bicarbonate with meals, monitor for side effects, prepare for dialysis discussion
